meanings.definition: To remove the flesh or outer covering from (a body or object)
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists carefully skeletonized the ancient remains to study the bones.
meanings.sent2: The butcher skeletonized the chicken before preparing it for cooking.
meanings.sent3: After Halloween, the pumpkin was skeletonized, leaving only the seeds for roasting.
meanings.sent4: The artist skeletonized the landscape, capturing only the bare bones of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The wind and rain skeletonized the old barn, revealing its wooden structure.

meanings.definition: To reduce (something) to its bare essentials or structure
meanings.sent1: The editor skeletonized the lengthy article to make it more concise.
meanings.sent2: The designer skeletonized the complex design, focusing on the key elements.
meanings.sent3: The chef skeletonized the recipe, simplifying it for beginners.
meanings.sent4: The teacher skeletonized the lesson plan, highlighting the main concepts.
meanings.sent5: The architect skeletonized the building plans, emphasizing the core features.
